events.name: custom-message
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend sends a custom message.

events.name: get-context-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests the context data.

events.name: navigation-request
events.description: Event fired when a navigation has been requested by the micro frontend.

events.name: show-alert-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to show an alert. It's dispatched with the payload shown below - some properties are optional. Read more about `showAlert` params [here](https://docs.luigi-project.io/docs/luigi-core-api?section=showalert). @type {Object.<string, unknown | AlertRequestPayload>} @example payload: { text: 'Custom alert message', type: 'info', links: { goToHome: { text: 'Homepage', url: '/overview' }, goToOtherProject: { text: 'Other project', url: '/projects/pr2' }, relativePath: { text: 'Hide side nav', url: 'hideSideNav' }, neverShowItAgain: { text: 'Never show it again', dismissKey: 'neverShowItAgain' } }, closeAfter: 3000 }

events.name: initialized
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend has been initialized.

events.name: add-search-params-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests the addition of search parameters to the URL.

events.name: add-node-params-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests the addition of node parameters to the URL.

events.name: show-confirmation-modal-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to show a confirmation modal. It's dispatched with the payload shown below - some properties are optional. Read more about `showConfirmationModal` params [here](https://docs.luigi-project.io/docs/luigi-core-api?section=showconfirmationmodal). @type {Object.<string, unknown | ConfirmationModalRequestPayload>} @example payload: { header: 'Confirmation', body: 'Are you sure you want to do this?', buttonConfirm: 'Yes', buttonDismiss: 'No' }

events.name: show-loading-indicator-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to show a loading indicator.

events.name: hide-loading-indicator-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to hide the loading indicator.

events.name: set-current-locale-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set the current locale. It's dispatched with the payload shown below. @type {Object.<string, unknown>} @example payload: { currentLocale: 'en' }

events.name: set-storage-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to modify the local storage. It's dispatched with the payload shown below. @type {Object.<string, unknown>} @example payload: { key: 'luigi-version', value: '2.21.0' }

events.name: runtime-error-handling-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to handle errors that might happen during the runtime of the micro frontend.

events.name: set-anchor-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set the anchor of the URL. It's dispatched with the payload - string value (like 'some-anchor').

events.name: set-third-party-cookies-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set third-party cookies.

events.name: get-current-route-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests the current app route. It's dispatched with the payload shown below - some properties are optional. @type {Object.<string, unknown | CurrentRouteRequestPayload>} @example payload: { fromClosestContext: false, fromContext: null, fromParent: true, fromVirtualTreeRoot: false, nodeParams: {} }

events.name: report-navigation-completed-request
events.description: Event fired to report that the micro frontend's navigation has completed.

events.name: update-modal-path-data-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to update the modal path parameters. It's dispatched with the payload shown below - some properties are optional. @type {Object.<string, unknown | ModalPathDataRequestPayload>} @example payload: { fromClosestContext: false, fromContext: null, fromParent: true, fromVirtualTreeRoot: false, history: true, link: '/test/route', modal: { title: 'Some modal' }, nodeParams: {} }

events.name: update-modal-settings-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to update the modal settings. It's dispatched with the payload shown below - some properties are optional. Read more about `updateModalSettings` params [here](https://docs.luigi-project.io/docs/luigi-client-api?section=updatemodalsettings). @type {Object.<string, unknown | ModalSettingsRequestPayload>} @example payload: { addHistoryEntry: true, updatedModalSettings: {} }

events.name: check-path-exists-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to check the validity of a path. It's dispatched with the payload shown below. @type {Object.<string, unknown>} @example payload: { link: '/test/route' }

events.name: set-dirty-status-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set the 'dirty status' which, for example, avoids closing when there are any unsaved changes. It's dispatched with the payload shown below. @type {Object.<string, unknown>} @example payload: { dirty: true }

events.name: set-viewgroup-data-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set the view group data.

events.name: open-user-settings-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to open the user settings.

events.name: close-user-settings-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to close the user settings.

events.name: collapse-leftnav-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to collapse left side navigation.

events.name: update-top-navigation-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to update the top navigation.

events.name: go-back-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to navigate back.

events.name: has-back-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to check if there are any preserved views.

events.name: add-backdrop-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to display the backdrop.

events.name: remove-backdrop-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to remove the backdrop.

events.name: custom-message
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend sends a custom message.

events.name: get-context-request
events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests the context data.

events.name: navigation-request
events.description: Event fired when a navigation has been requested by the micro frontend.

events.description: Event fired when the micro frontend requests to show an alert. It's dispatched with the payload shown below - some properties are optional.
